head.supplied: Melbourne bot. & zool. Garden, ¶ 6. June 1860 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the liquidation of the byefollowing account for seeds, ordered from Messrs Ja...

div.p: O60/4831, unit 748, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the liquidation of the byefollowing account for seeds, ordered from Messrs James Carter & Co of London, through the Agent General of the colony Victoria in London, the claimant having failed to appoint a party in Melbourne to receive at the treasury of this city the amount due, & payable out of the vote of "purchase of plants" placed by your Honor at my disposal.
On 16 June 1860, the Under Secretary, J. Moore, minuted: 'The Hon the Treasurer has just now sent word that the amount can be remitted and placed in the hands of the Agent-General to the credit of Jas Carter & Co. whom Dr Mueller will I presume advise by this mail. The total expense ( £12.13/. ) has been charged against the vote for "Purchase of Plants 1860".' On 16 June, M noted on the file: "Messrs James Carter & Co have been informed by this mail, that His Honor the Chief Secretary has been pleased to order the liquidation of the debt through the Colonial Agent, London.' Letter not found.

div.p: I have the honor to be,

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant
